trustfund:
TF094016-CO-FINANCING OF THE LIBERIA
            COMMUNITY EMPOWERMENT PROJECT II,TF092325-COFINANCING OF LIBERIA
            COMMUNITY EMPOWERMENT PROJECT II

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Community
            Empowerment Project (CEP-II) for Liberia were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately satisfactory, risk to development
            outcome was substantial, Bank performance was satisfactory,
            and Borrower performance was moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: the community-driven development
            (CDD) approach can be an effective instrument not only to
            empower communities but also to develop leadership and
            implementation capacity of local institutions that can
            enhance social service delivery in the short term and
            facilitate between different stakeholders in fragile
            environments. Stakeholder and donor coordination is
            essential in all development activities in a post conflict
            context, especially during the transition from relief to
            development phase where priorities need to be clearly
            identified and sequenced. Careful attention to fiduciary and
            project management skills in a low capacity, post conflict
            setting proved to be a critical factor that contributed to
            the success of the project. Transparency in the payment
            process to project participants contributed to improving the
            CEP-II administration in low capacity environment.
